chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mechelle R Lake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Jennifer Sagen.

No contact with any known drug users or dealers.

DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

DE will comply with all assessments/recommendations from DOC agent.

DE will pay all financial obligations and supervision fees.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Mechelle R Lake in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No additions or corrections to the PSI, argument will be entered by both sides.  State begins their argument.  Atty McClain enters argument.  DE makes a statement.  Court will Impose/Stay 9 months jail, will order 2 years probation, CC, DNA sample and surcharge, restitution of $30.00, no firearms, No contact with Jennifer Sagen, no assossication with known drug dealers or users, 2 days credit, comply with all recommendations of the DOC agent.
